terminology: Perimenopause - the 4-10 year transition before menopause when hormone fluctuations begin, often starting in early-to-mid 40s
Menopause - officially 12 months without a period, average age 51, when estrogen and progesterone production significantly decreases
Estrogen dominance - when estrogen is high relative to progesterone, common in perimenopause, causes many symptoms
Progesterone - the calming hormone that drops first in perimenopause, affects sleep, mood, and anxiety
Cortisol - stress hormone produced by adrenals, chronically elevated cortisol worsens all hormone symptoms
Thyroid connection - thyroid dysfunction is common in perimenopause and shares many symptoms, often overlooked
H.O.R.M.O.N.E. Method - Heal, Optimize, Restore, Move, Observe, Nourish, Empower framework
Adrenal fatigue - when chronic stress depletes the adrenal glands' ability to produce hormones, worsens menopause symptoms
Scope of practice - facilitate hormone wellness through lifestyle, not diagnose conditions or replace medical care
clientExamples: Women 42-58 going through perimenopause and menopause who feel dismissed by conventional medicine
